cooking_method: In a medium saucepan, bring the chicken broth to a boil. Add the lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and bird's eye chilies. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook until softened, about 2-3 minutes. Serve hot.

Soak the rice noodles in warm water for 15 minutes. In a wok or large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and tofu and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the soaked rice noodles, fish sauce, and tamarind paste. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, or until the noodles are cooked through. Serve hot.

In a large pot, heat the coconut milk over medium heat. Add the green curry paste and stir to combine. Add the chicken thighs, eggplant, and red bell pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender. Serve hot.

In a wok or large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and chilies and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the ground pork and cook until browned and crispy, about 5-7 minutes. Add the fish sauce and stir to combine. Serve hot.

In a large pot, heat the coconut milk over medium heat. Add the massaman curry paste and stir to combine. Add the beef chuck roast, sweet potato, and onion. Simmer for 2-3 hours, or until the beef is tender and the vegetables are soft. Serve hot.

In a large bowl, mix together the grated green papaya and carrot. In a separate bowl, whisk together the lime juice, fish sauce, and palm sugar. Pour the dressing over the papaya and carrot mixture and toss to combine. Serve cold.

ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
cooking_method: In a wok or large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and chilies and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add the chicken breast and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Add the fresh basil leaves and stir to combine. Serve hot.

Soak the glutinous rice in water for 30 minutes. In a saucepan, combine the soaked glutinous rice, coconut milk, and sugar. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until the rice is cooked and the mixture is thick and sticky, about 20-25 minutes. Serve with sliced mangoes on top.
